message: The 115th Congress is officially in session! Speaker Paul Ryan has been re-elected Speaker of the House and we're pushing ahead on our #BetterWay agenda. Learn more at http://abetterway.speaker.gov/
Big congratulations to the #Lansing Everett Viking Marching Band - what an exciting opportunity! #MI08

It has been a true honor to serve Michigan's 8th District and I'm looking forward to a productive two years ahead. Thanks to Matt McClain with the Washington Post for capturing this great moment after Speaker Paul Ryan's re-elect earlier this week.

Today I spoke about my support for the #REINSAct, which would restore the constitutional authority of Congress and rein in runaway government. Did you know, in 2014, federal regulations imposed on America’s job creators and households created a staggering economic burden of almost $2 trillion? That’s almost $15,000 per U.S. household. We must restore the balance of powers as they were intended.
Our Founding Fathers built a democracy for the people, and the #REINSAct is an important step to restore the balance of power as it was intended. #MI08
Proud to work with my friend Representative Mark Walker as a new member of the Republican Study Committee's Steering Committee in the 115th Congress! #MI08
Praying for everyone at the #FortLauderdale Airport right now - sad news breaking about horrific violence that has taken place there today.
Outstanding news! The Chevy Bolt EV was named the #NAIAS2017 Car of the Year, made right here in #MI08! Congrats to Chevrolet General Motors and their entire Michigan team.

While you can’t break what’s already broken, you can keep a promise you made to the American people—greater access to affordable, quality, patient-centered care. This week, Congress is working on the first steps to do just that. #BetterWay

I'm proud to show support for National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day (#LEAD) at our Washington, D.C. office. A big thank you to all the men and women in uniform who protect our community. #MI08 Police Officers Association of Michigan
Congrats to Lansing, Michigan's Niowave, Inc. on receiving the U.S. Small Business Administration's prestigious Tibbetts Award! #MI08

Here are the numbers that explain how Obamacare is creating hardships for many working families and small business owners - including those in our own community - and why Republicans are determined to change it:

Proud to see the Regulatory Accountability Act - which I am a co-sponsor of - pass the House tonight. House Republicans remain commitment to improving transparency in the rulemaking process. Lawmaking power belongs with the people's representatives, not agency bureaucrats.
NA
NA

Congrats to the Michigan State University College of Human Medicine on your grant from the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services to develop a registry for Flint residents exposed to lead drinking water. This will make a notable difference to ensure help is delivered to all those affected. #SpartansWill #MI08 #GoGreen
"Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere." Today we remember one of the greatest American leaders, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., and the profound impact he left on our nation. #MLKDay

Proud of Ryan Zinke on his nomination for U.S. Department of the Interior Secretary. A Montana native and natural-born leader, he will do outstanding things for America's parks, public lands and natural resources.
Sending my well wishes for a speedy recovery to both President Bush and Barbara. #41

#ICYMI: A decision all Michiganders can be grateful for - thank you, General Motors! Looking forward to doing my part in Congress to create a positive, pro-growth environment in 2017 - to keep & create more jobs in Michigan and the U.S.! More great news from our automotive industry. #ComebackState
NA
My Detroit Free Press op-ed with Rep. Paul Mitchell, Congressman Dave Trott and Rep Tim Walberg on why we must address the growing health care crisis in America, published today:

It is an honor to represent the people of Michigan’s Eighth District, and I am truly grateful to have shared this historic #InaugurationDay with my family today. The presidential swearing-in ceremony is a culmination of the past, present and future of our nation’s history. It represents a new beginning, but also serves as a humbling reminder of everything our Founding Fathers built for us.  We have faced many battles as a nation, and America has always persevered. Our government must do better for the American people – so every family can get ahead, so every individual can exercise his or her freedom, so everyone can realize their dreams. We live in the greatest nation in the world and I look forward to working with President Trump and Vice President Pence to build on that in the years ahead.
NA

It is unacceptable for the greatest nation in the world to settle for health care that does not work for everyone. When a law has unintended consequences, it must be addressed. We have an obligation to do something for all those who have been forced into a worse situation by our government – including our own neighbors. The Livingston Daily Press & Argus #MI08
My FULL STATEMENT on the immigration Executive Order #MI08 https://mikebishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/bishop-statement-trump-immigration-order

Hosted a great tele-townhall tonight on health care and the Executive Order on immigration. Call my office to get added to our next event this month, many more to come. District: 810-227-8600. D.C.: 202-805-5619  #MI08

Michigan reps. Congressman Dave Trott, Rep. Paul Mitchell, Rep. John Moolenaar, Rep. Jack Bergman, Congressman Dan Kildee, Rep. Debbie Dingell. Rep. Brenda Lawrence, Rep Sandy Levin and I joined members from other Great Lakes states in asking President Trump’s administration to stop a controversial Canadian plan for disposing nuclear waste near Lake Huron. The Great Lakes are of the utmost importance to our environment and economy, and we simply cannot take on a risk like this. #MI08
Met with Ambassador Pisan Manawapat today to talk about Thai Summit America’s role as a local auto supplier in #MI08, as well as the important partnership between our two nations.

Most Americans would be shocked to know we currently operate under a 30-year old internet privacy law – from a time when social media, electronic payments and ‘the cloud’ were far from existence. My full statement on passage of the "Email Privacy Act" tonight:

America faces many of the same challenges Michigan once did – and that’s why I came to Congress. We can absolutely get our economy back on track, just as we did in the Comeback State. It begins with #taxreform. My full piece on Fox News:
NA
In case you missed it, today I spoke with David Asman on Fox Business "After the Bell" about the need for #taxreform. Congress is already at work; 2017 is the year to do this.

Today I was selected to serve on the House Committee on Ways and Means. I'm so grateful for this opportunity and look forward to working hard for Michigan families and workers on my new committee. #MI08
NA

Another productive tele-townhall - 60,000 households contacted so far this year. Our next call is Wednesday, March 1 @ 7:00-8:00pm. If you haven't already been added to our list and are a constituent, call our team to join: - Washington, DC office: 202-225-4872 - Brighton, MI office: 810-227-8600

Last night, House Committee on Energy and Commerce Chairman Greg Walden introduced the "Pre-existing Conditions Protection Act of 2017." I became an original co-sponsor because constituents on both sides of the aisle have raised deep concerns about this issue. I want you to know I hear those concerns loud and clear. That’s why I support this legislation - to ensure patients with pre-existing conditions have important protections beyond Obamacare. I want to make sure Michigan families have access to affordable health care, no matter how healthy or sick they are. #MI08

Grateful for the veterans who gave input at our Oakland-area listening session this district work period. We must do more to serve those who served us. If you or a family member are a veteran in #MI08 and have a problem with the VA or your benefits, please contact my office and a caseworker can further assist you: 810-227-8600.

#ICYMI: Rep. Debbie Dingell and I appeared on WDIV Local 4 / ClickOnDetroit's #Flashpoint with Devin Scillian last Sunday. You can catch our segment on their website: http://www.clickondetroit.com/flashpoint/flashpoint-2192017-health-care-national-security-and-president-trumps-news-conference
NA

Metro Detroit has lost a real community servant. Prayers for the family of Ron Savage, Fox 2, and all those who were impacted by the wonderful things he did for our region. "You don't have to be perfect, just do your best."

NATO member nations must honor their commitment to spending on defense. Without modern equipment, resources, manpower and training necessary to maintain our strength, we risk continued challenges to peace here and around the world. More about my resolution:

Did you know only 5 out of 28 NATO nations meet or exceed their commitment for defense spending today? To be completely effective – and to equally share the necessary burden of "peace through strength" – all NATO members must step up.
Great to meet with cancer survivor and Williamston resident Dr. James Hillard today. We talked about Debbie's Dream Foundation: Curing Stomach Cancer and vital funding for cancer research. #MI08
NA

People often ask me, "Who is saying health care isn't affordable?" or "Who exactly is being HURT by Obamacare?" I'll tell you that I hear from people with real stories like these - in Michigan's 8th District - every day. I'm talking about our neighbors, our friends and family members, who are being adversely affected by a law that forces people to buy coverage that doesn't necessarily work for them. The American people have spoken. Doing nothing is not an option.
NA
In case you missed it: I am an original co-sponsor of House Committee on Energy and Commerce Greg Walden's bill to continue protecting patients with pre-existing conditions, beyond Obamacare:
NA
In case you missed it, Rep. Bill Huizenga, Representative Marcy Kaptur and I sent a bipartisan letter to the President on Friday asking for help fighting invasive species in our #GreatLakes:
NA

BIG NEWS: Residents across #MI08 have been asking for tangible bills - a real solution - to repeal and replace Obamacare. Tonight, we are releasing The American Health Care Act.  Our fiscally responsible legislation delivers relief from Obamacare’s taxes and mandates and lays the groundwork for a 21st century health care system. #ReadTheBill and learn more: www.ReadTheBill.gop

Rep. Kevin Brady, Chairman of the Committee on Ways and Means, on our plan for better health care:  "We begin by repealing the awful taxes, the mandate penalties, and the subsidies in Obamacare. And to give Americans the freedom to buy plans that they need. That includes nearly doubling the size of the health savings accounts and make them more usable. That’s good for the out-of-pocket costs. But we give them a tax credit, immediately usable, that ranges in price from $2,000 to $14,000 a year, depends upon their age and their family."  MORE from his interview with Fox News here:

People have got to try and stop stirring the pot of human emotion. The fear of losing healthcare is something we should not threaten people with. We are not going to be pulling out the rug from under people. The plan is to ensure that those that have a healthcare plan will still continue to have one moving forward. #MI08
NA
NA

WATCH: The Committee on Ways and Means is marking-up the American Health Care Act all day today. We're working to repeal and replace Obamacare - to provide much-needed relief to the American people being crushed by its many taxes and mandates:

Our Committee on Ways and Means mark-up is still going strong. After 9 hours of non-germane amendments, we're finally on to substantial votes. This is just the first of many more steps to come, and I will be sharing insight as we push ahead on health care reform. You can watch us live tonight: https://youtu.be/3RMbUKK9ETs
NA

The road to health care reform is a weeks-long process, and it will be open and transparent every step of the way. Right now, we're only on step 1. We will have a CBO score - and every American will know what is in this bill - before it goes to a vote on the House floor. Committee on Ways and Means

We're providing Americans with immediate relief from the failing law, and laying a strong foundation for a 21st century health care system based on what patients and families need, not what Washington dictates. #ReadTheBill
Sleeves up & ready to get to work! Speaker Paul Ryan is giving a LIVE presentation about the health care reform process - steps, what's ahead, and how it works. TUNE IN via the link below:
“I would hope we can all agree this is not how health care is supposed to be,” Rep. Mike Bishop (R-Mich.) said. “That is unacceptable and we can and must do better.”
The American Health Care Act has moved through the Committee on Ways and Means. This is the first step of many; Republicans are determined to make health care right. #ReadTheBill #MI08

People often write on my wall asking who exactly is being hurt by #Obamacare. Take Deanna, Kristyn or Denise and her husband - all of whom live in #MI08. Their stories are real, and there are millions more just like them happening every single day. Too many Americans are being forced to pay for costly coverage that doesn't work for them. I hope we can agree that's not how health care should be. #RepealAndReplace #ReadTheBill #AHCA Committee on Ways and Means

NA

America cannot settle for the status quo. Obamacare was full of broken promises from the get go, and it continues to collapse under its own weight. Doing nothing is not an option. Speaker Paul Ryan Committee on Ways and Means #RepealAndReplace #MI08

Obamacare was based on a one-size-fits-all approach that put bureaucrats in charge of your health care. What we’re proposing will deliver the control and choice individuals and families need to access health care that’s right for them. #PassTheBill #RepealAndReplace

Speaker Paul Ryan: We've been listening to our members, finding out where the consensus is, and making improvements to the AHCA as we’ve gone on through the legislative process... The president has said, let’s see if we can add to the people who are getting assistance who don’t get health care from their job, who are older—maybe in their 50s or their 60s—to make sure they’re in a good place as well. So we’re doing even more assistance there. FULL INTERVIEW:
Praying for our friends in the U.K. Parliament, law enforcement and innocent civilians hurt in London.

Today the House Judiciary Committee is marking up two of my bills - #MobileWorkforce dealing with state income tax laws, and #CPIA to further protect our children. Let's keep the momentum going! #MI08
Here is my statement on the bipartisan #CPIA, led with Congressman Adam Schiff, which is being addressed in the House Judiciary Committee markup today:

Speaker Paul Ryan: This is the boldest and most conservative health-care legislation to come before Congress in decades. Bold because it dismantles the progressive health-care experiment and replaces it with a dynamic, patient-centered system. Conservative because it applies America’s founding principles—freedom, free enterprise and federalism—to the problems of the day. #RepealAndReplace #PassTheBill

#MI08 high school students: The Congressional Art Competition is back! This year's deadline to drop off artwork at our district office is Friday, April 28 by 5:00pm. For rules and entry information, please visit my website. Good luck!
It was great to see Rob, Sue, and our friends from the Council of Michigan Foundations recently. We had the chance to discuss issues facing non-profits and the Great Lakes. #MI08

Rep. John Moolenaar and I met with the Michigan Bankers Association last week to talk about rolling back the massive regulatory burdens of the last few years and bringing more economic growth to Michigan #MI08

Today I met with members of the Alzheimer's Association - all of whom were from #MI08. They shared their families’ difficult stories about the disease and the incredible sacrifices they have made to care for their loved ones. I was inspired by their selflessness and unwavering commitment to finding a cure. #ENDALZ
Great to meet you all! Keep up the great work. #MI08

Last year, I was on the congressional panel - with members selected from the House and Senate - to work on the final draft of a bill to address America's growing opioid epidemic. We passed what is known today as the "Comprehensive Addiction and Recovery Act" (#CARA), which became law. It addresses prevention, treatment, recovery, law enforcement, criminal justice reform, and overdose reversal. I'm glad to see our new President has also created a Commission to find more ways to make an impact in 2017 and beyond. But the epidemic remains a growing problem in #MI08, and beyond the funding and actions taken so far, we MUST do more. I will do whatever I can to support this effort in Congress. Lansing State Journal:

Today Rep. Debbie Dingell and I led a bipartisan letter to address the serious concerns with the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services' proposed 2018 cuts to Medicare Advantage Retiree Coverage. More than 400,000 beneficiaries would be hurt by this potential change. We are united in fighting for all those who depend on this important coverage. #MI08

The Lansing City Council has not only ignored the input and safety of legal residents and families in Lansing, but they have disregarded every immigrant who entered our country the legal way. Communities cannot simply pick and choose which laws they wish to follow.

The info is up! If you live in #MI08 and want to participate in one of my upcoming townhall listening sessions, please check out my website and sign up. Events will be filled on a first come, first serve basis. https://mikebishop.house.gov/townhall

It was a very productive day yesterday in Brighton as we hosted 3 townhall listening sessions over the course of the day. I represent everyone in #MI08 and really appreciated this opportunity to hear from all sides of the issues we face today. I have three more sessions coming up in Ingham County next week and I'm looking to do more events like this in Oakland County soon, so please stay tuned.
To all our friends in the Jewish community, have a happy Passover celebration! #MI08
Good to catch up with Pat and the Howell Area Chamber of Commerce yesterday. Thank you for having me in to talk about the big issues we face here in #MI08 and across the nation.

This morning I met with local veterans and county veteran affairs counselors. We talked about the issues facing female veterans, homelessness, reserve military education benefit issues, VA medical concerns and current legislation that will help those who have served our country. #MI08 #ThankAVet

This week I stopped by the Consumers Energy Howell Service Center to talk with the employees and tour the grounds. It was a good discussion with their team, talking about the future of infrastructure, tax reform, health care, economic develop and protecting our Great Lakes. Thanks for all the good work you do! #MI08

Enjoyed meeting with the team at Forest Community Health Center, part of the Ingham County Health Department. They are doing a lot of good for our community. We talked about many big issues surrounding the health care debate and protecting funding for NIH. #MI08
Wishing all our friends of the Christian faith a blessed Good Friday, full of love and reflection.
Happy Easter, #MI08! I hope you and your family are having a wonderful celebration today. He is risen!

It's #TaxDay, and once again Americans are being forced to spend billions of dollars and hours complying with today's overly complicated code... The Committee on Ways and Means' Tax Blueprint would change that. #MI08

Did you know Americans will spend more than 8.9 billion hours doing their taxes for 2016? This comes out to roughly 4.3 million full-time workers doing nothing but tax paperwork all year... We have to do better. Our #TaxBlueprint focuses in on this. Read more from Rep. Kevin Brady:

Today I had the first meeting with our newly-formed 8th District Veterans Advisory Board at our Brighton office today. I am so grateful for the opportunity to have quarterly meetings with these constituent veterans. During our 90 minute conversation, each veteran spoke of issues in their designated areas of expertise. All of the topics we covered will be reviewed by our district staff and legislative team in D.C. in order to better serve those who served us. In the meantime, if you're having a problem with veterans benefits or services and need assistance, please contact my office: 810-227-8600.

It was great to meet with the HIMSS and Sparrow Health System team this week to learn about the outstanding care and innovative new IT programs they are implementing right here in #MI08. Sitting down with their team, I learned about their system of care delivery from the #SparrowWay all the way to the patient. When I head back to Washington D.C., I plan to look into more of the cybersecurity challenges they face, as well as legislative solutions to improve patient access and engagement in 2017.

We had 3 more townhall listening sessions in Ingham County last week - thank you to everyone who was part of those discussions. I'm planning to do more in Oakland County in the coming weeks, so please stay tuned! I will post more information once the details are set. #MI08
Reminder #MI08 high school students: the deadline for all Congressional Art Competition entries to be dropped off at the Brighton district office is this FRIDAY, 4/28. Visit my website for more info:
NA
Drug take-back programs are a great first step to stopping prescription drug abuse – and getting rid of unused pills in a safe, eco-friendly way. Let’s get involved this weekend, #MI08.
On Saturday, the Detroit Institute of Arts will host “Oakland County Day” and will provide free transportation to and from the museum - from locations in and around #MI08: http://tickets.dia.org

Enjoyed meeting with 8th grade students from Immaculate Heart of Mary (Lansing) in Washington, D.C. yesterday. We had a nice discussion in the historic Committee on Ways and Means hearing room, thanks for stopping by! #MI08

Rochester Adams High School has been named the 4th best high school in Michigan and the 319th best in the country by U.S. News and World Report! As a graduate of the school, I am so proud to see their outstanding work continue through the years. #MI08

On Saturday, you can give a shelter pet a loving home without paying an adoption fee - locations in Mason, Lansing, Okemos, Howell, Auburn Hills are participating #MI08 #EmptyTheShelters  Ingham County: http://www.lansingstatejournal.com/story/news/local/2017/04/27/saturday-empty-shelters-day/100956518/   Livingston County: https://www.facebook.com/Livingston-County-Animal-Shelter-176835095680976/   Oakland County: http://www.theoaklandpress.com/general-news/20170424/free-adoption-day-april-29-at-oakland-county-animal-control-and-adoption-center?source=most_viewed
This week, I signed on to a bipartisan letter urging the EPA not to close a regional office serving the #GreatLakes region. #MI08

Just got word the 2017 Senior Survivor games at Howell High School have come to a close, and the students have officially raised a record $78,000 for the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention. I am so impressed by their hard work and dedication for this meaningful cause. Over the last 10 years, Senior Survivors have raised over a quarter-million dollars for the charities of their choice. Outstanding work, Highlanders! #MI08 Howell Public School District
Support your local community by shopping small this week. If you are a small business owner or shopper, thank you for making a positive impact in #MI08!

From the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative #GLRI to Michigan State University’s world-renowned Facility for Rare Isotope Beams #FRIB, many of the projects that are vital to Michigan and the Eighth District are fully funded at their authorized levels with the legislation passed today. I will continue to work with my colleagues to develop more long-term funding solutions and, above all, meaningful ways to slash the unsustainable debt in this country. #MI08
To clarify, protections for pre-existing conditions are an absolutely pivotal part of the American Health Care Act. I would not have supported it otherwise. #MI08

It's been more than seven months and we need an update on the status of the disbursement process for victims of the #NECC fungal meningitis outbreak. Time is of the essence, and my 11 colleagues who joined me on this bipartisan letter agree.
Looking forward to the Committee on Ways and Means hearing next week about our bold plan for #TaxReform in 2017. Stay tuned, #MI08.

The Livingston County Sheriff's "Youth Explorer Program" recently took first place at the annual Michigan Law Enforcement Youth Association Committee State Competition. The program is made up of teens and young adults who are interested in law enforcement. Keep up the great work! #MI08

‪We had a great Medal of Merit ceremony at the Capitol in Lansing on Friday - an annual celebration for our outstanding high school seniors across #MI08 who are nominated by their respective schools for their community involvement and leadership. Congrats & best of luck to all after graduation!
Thank you to all the men and women in uniform who keep #MI08 safe. Your selfless sacrifice does not go unnoticed. #PoliceWeek2017

The Michigan State Police Brighton Post will host a 100th anniversary open house on Thursday, May 18th. They invite the community to attend and celebrate with troopers and other emergency responders. Thank you to all our men and women in blue! #PoliceWeek2017 #MI08
Pro-growth tax reform means you get to keep more of what you earned. Watch our Committee on Ways and Means hearing live tomorrow (Thursday) @ 10am: waysandmeans.house.gov/live/
Follow up from our Committee on Ways and Means Human Resources Subcommittee hearing today:

I always enjoy meeting with AP Government classes across #MI08, and last week was no different. We had a great discussion at Mason High School on Friday. The students had thoughtful questions about the differences between the state and federal legislature, the role of social media today, and what issues we're working on in Congress. Thanks to all for being part of this constructive dialogue - keep up the good work!
What if filing your taxes was as easy as filling out a postcard? That's part of our Committee on Ways and Means #taxreform plan: https://waysandmeans.house.gov/growth-simplicity-service/
It's time to put the American worker first. See how the Committee on Ways and Means plan for #taxreform will do just that - tomorrow @ 10am: waysandmeans.house.gov/live
This is what bipartisanship looks like. Thanks to Congressman Adam Schiff for his work on this - our #CPIA bill has passed the House! #KeepKidsSafe
It's a new day in #Manchester. Please continue praying for all the parents and children impacted by the devastation last night. The U.S. and our allies will always stand stronger - together.

Tune in now to see how our Committee on Ways and Means plan for #taxreform will end special interest loopholes: http://waysandmeans.house.gov/live

Met with members of the Michigan Academy of Family Physicians from #MI08 in Washington, D.C. today. We talked about the impact of having primary care doctors available in our communities and ways to improve Graduate Medical Education for future Primary Care residents. Thanks for what you do.
This #MemorialDay, learn about the valiant service of all the brave men and women who have fought for our freedom over the years. #LibraryOfCongress #VeteransHistoryProject #LOCvets

"Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends." - John 15:13. This weekend and all year long, we are grateful for our men and women of the military and remember those who have made the ultimate sacrifice for our freedom. God Bless The U.S.A. #MemorialDay

Today marks the 73rd anniversary of the #DDay landings. We remember the unspeakable courage of all those who persevered in the face of evil and will never forget those who gave their lives to protect us on that pivotal day.
NA

What Americans were promised when the Dodd-Frank Act passed in 2010… (versus what we actually got):  - The economy would be uplifted… (The slowest recovery in 70 years). - Taxpayer-funded bailouts would end… (Wall Street bailouts were enshrined into law). - The financial system would be safer… (Big banks are even bigger than before, and community banks & credit unions are being crushed daily). - Consumers would be protected… (Higher banking fees, more expensive mortgages, fewer choices and an unaccountable Consumer Financial Protection Bureau).  Dodd-Frank has failed and it’s time for Congress to make the right choice: www.financialchoice.gop

Passing the Financial #CHOICEact means:  * Ending big bank bailouts * Imposing the toughest penalties ever for deception on Wall Street * Helping families achieve financial independence * Supporting community banks and local credit unions
NA

Under #DoddFrank, America is losing 1 community bank or credit union each day. This does not make our financial system safer or help our local communities. It's time for the Financial #CHOICEact. House Committee on Financial Services www.financialchoice.gop

"In other words, the biggest U.S. banks likely would not get relief from the new banking rules in the Financial CHOICE Act. In the budget office's estimation, most of the banks that would opt for the higher capital requirement would be small community banks." #CHOICEact House Committee on Financial Services
#FACT: Under Dodd-Frank, it's much harder for families to get free checking today.
Classic example of what's going on in MI under #DoddFrank. It's time for the Financial #CHOICEAct.
Congratulations to the graduates of the Howell Schools Fire Academy. Thank you for getting involved! #MI08

This week, our delegation's bipartisan Soo Locks modernization bill was introduced by Congressman Bergman (MI-01) and Senator Stabenow. The Locks are a pivotal part of Michigan’s economy, the Midwest region and our nation's infrastructure as a whole. It is so important that our delegation works together to ensure this essential gateway through the Great Lakes can continue operating for years to come. #MI08 #GreatLakes
VIA POLITICO: "High costs and lack of affordability" were the most common reasons why 2 million people did not renew their Obamacare coverage as of mid-March.
Ensuring only the best people work at the VA means better care for our veterans, plain and simple. I look forward to the president signing this bipartisan bill into law. #VAaccountability
At our charity baseball practice this morning, a lone gunman open fired on members of our team and security. Several down including Majority Whip Congressman Steve Scalise - please pray for them.

It's gameday. Ready to get back on the field and play our charity game tonight like Congressman Steve Scalise and Matt Mika would want us to. Please continue sending good thoughts their way; they have a long road ahead. And thank you for all the kind wishes. The Capitol Police saved our lives yesterday and will forever have our gratitude. Our nation's officers are truly heroes, every day. #CongressionalBaseballGame

The House just took a bipartisan step toward streamlining the state income tax reporting and filing process today. By simplifying these requirements across America, we can reduce compliance costs and confusing paperwork for everyone involved. Thanks to House Judiciary Committee Chairman Goodlatte, Congressman Hank Johnson, our 57 Republican and Democrat co-sponsors and more than 300 organizations across numerous industries - including the Michigan Association of CPAs - for supporting our #MobileWorkforce bill.

Big week at the House Appropriations Committee. Glad to see they are supporting FULL funding of our Great Lakes Restoration Initiative at $300 million. #GLRI #ProtectOurGreatLakes #MI08
Great news: the House Appropriations Committee has approved FULL funding for the #FRIB at Michigan State University! #GoGreen #MI08 My full statement today:

Enjoyed meeting with Howell High School student Lauren Hauk in Washington, D.C. today. She's a Youth Correspondent at the Washington Journalism and Media Conference going on this week. Thanks for stopping by the #MI08 office and sharing some great questions with us. Keep up the great work!

Congratulations on 25 outstanding years, Livingston County Habitat for Humanity! We are grateful for the difference you make, including rehabilitating 18 homes in our community and fighting homelessness across the globe. #MI08

I’m proud to support our men and women of the military with passage of the NDAA today, which includes funding the largest troop pay raise in eight years. With new challenges from an increasingly belligerent Russian state, instability across the Middle East and North Africa, and emerging cybersecurity threats, my amendment also calls on all NATO allies to honor their commitments and invest in defense. This is out of fairness – for our effort to evenly share this responsibility, and fairness to American taxpayers. #NDAA #MI08 #NATO #SupportOurTroops
Congrats to Jaycie Brown of Pinckney on this outstanding award! Keep up the great work. #MI08

Today the House is set to take action on the biggest GI bill expansion in a decade - HR 3218, which I am a proud original co-sponsor of. As things stand today, veterans have to use their education benefits within 15 years of the end of their service. With today's legislation, we’re taking those limits away. From now on, new servicemembers will be able to use the GI bill’s education benefits throughout their lifetimes. This GI bill also gives veterans a better shot at in-demand science and technology jobs. LEARN MORE about the ways we are creating what the American Legion calls "a new era for all who have honorably served in uniform." #ForeverGIBill #MI08

Today I joined the House in voting 419-3 to pass one of the most expansive sanctions packages to increase political and economic pressures on Iran, Russia and North Korea. We cannot allow their brazen aggression to continue and I urge the President to support our bipartisan action.

"We are all united in the belief that the single most important action we can take to grow our economy and help the middle class get ahead is to fix our broken tax code for families, small business, and American job creators competing at home and around the globe."

My friend Congressman Steve Scalise - who was just discharged from the hospital this week - says it best: "Most people instinctively run from danger, but these officers did not hesitate to put their own lives on the line to run towards it that morning of June 14 to protect the lives of others. David, Crystal, Nicole, Kevin, and Alexander all have families of their own, yet they courageously confronted and stopped the shooter. Everyone who was at the ballpark that morning owes their lives to the selfless and brave actions of these heroes, and I cannot thank them enough."

God Bless America. #PatriotDay #September11 #NeverForget

The Wall Street Journal Editorial: The Tax Policy Center analysis is impossibly specific, given that the recent framework excluded the income ranges for the individual brackets of 12%, 25% and 35%; the value of the expanded child tax credit, and when that would phase out; rates for pass-through businesses, or safeguards for abuse that may limit who can claim the income or how much; the discount rate at which cash and other corporate assets will be invited back to the United States; which deductions will be eliminated; and many other details that would be essential for any honest score. #TaxReform Committee on Ways and Means

#TaxReform is about saving middle-income Americans' time and money. You should be able to spend more of your hard-earned money on what YOU want, instead of putting it toward doing your taxes. Committee on Ways and Means

Via The Wall Street Journal: Our Committee on Ways and Means tax reform framework "promotes entrepreneurship, the key to productivity growth. Productivity growth does not descend magically upon workers once they get up to speed in their jobs; it occurs when individuals take on new jobs better suited to their skill sets. The signal for this is that the new job pays more—if it didn’t, the worker probably wouldn’t take it. New jobs open up in the economy when businesses are formed that create fresh market niches and exploit existing ones more efficiently than legacy companies."

The time is now. Our vision for tax reform is about economic growth, Michigan middle-class families, and putting American interests first. Congressman Dave Trott Rep Tim Walberg Rep. John Moolenaar Fred Upton Rep. Bill Huizenga Rep. Jack Bergman Rep. Paul Mitchell

Remembering today the brave military members and civilians who lost their lives 76 years ago at Pearl Harbor. May we never forget the courage and sacrifice of the Americans who died and fought back in defense of our freedoms. #PearlHarbor76

The health of our Great Lakes is critical to all Michiganders, and over the past several months a growing list of communities are uncovering alarmingly high levels of toxic fluorochemical contamination in soil, ground and drinking water. That’s why I joined my colleagues in sending a bipartisan letter urging the EPA to take a stronger role in investigating and assisting the State of Michigan and the DOD’s efforts to address the serious health threats stemming from exposure to these chemicals. It’s critical this is managed as safely and effectively as possible.

I enjoying sitting down with Alyssa Turcsak from #MI08 recently to discuss H.Res. 466, a resolution promoting the Global Partnership for Education (GPE). GPE supports developing countries to ensure that every child receives a quality basic education, and I was pleased to sign on as a co-sponsor in the 115th Congress. Thanks Alyssa for your dedication to advocacy on behalf of education.

I commend the Big Red Barrel program, a project started by the Livingston County Community Alliance to assist individuals dispose of leftover pills safely and securely, on collecting 10,000 pounds of unused medication since 2011. A majority of abused prescription drugs are obtained from family and friends, that’s why it’s so important to keep unused prescriptions out of home medicine cabinets. If you have unwanted medications, you can locate an authorized drop-off in your area here: https://apps.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1
I really enjoyed the opportunity to spend some time at our Rochester Hills Public Library earlier this month and read "The Polar Express" to a group of young Michiganders. Thanks for having me!

I'm pleased to report that the Mass. AG’s office has begun disbursing payments to victims of the 2012 NECC fungal meningitis outbreak. As all of those affected know, the civil settlement funds provided by the NECC were woefully short of those needed to compensate victims for hospital stays, injuries and the irrevocable change in their way of life. That’s why I fought so hard to have $40 million set aside for these victims and their families. While no dollar amount will ever make these victims whole, I’m glad they’re finally getting some much-needed additional financial help.

The Great Lakes play an invaluable role in our daily life here in Michigan. Our environment, tourism, fishing and regional economy depend on the health and well-being of these precious waterways – and all are in serious jeopardy if we do not take immediate action against Asian carp.

Over the weekend, I joined Wreaths Across America- Great Lakes to place wreaths on the graves of our veterans. This wreath-laying effort was carried out across the country to thank, remember and honor the lives of our nation’s heroes. #WAA2017 #RememberHonorTeach

It's a historic day: our pro-growth #TaxReform bill passed the House! By doubling the standard deduction, doubling the child tax credit and cutting rates across the board, the House tax reform delivers for Michiganders at all income levels. This graphic by the independent, non-profit Tax Foundation gives a few examples of how the tax plan will help you and your family keep more of your hard-earned money.

By passing this comprehensive tax reform package, we've delivered on our promise to provide real relief to hardworking families at every income level. Furthermore, by preserving important deductions like higher education tax relief for our students, the medical expense deduction, and expanding the child tax credit, families will be empowered to save and plan for their future. Learn more: https://fairandsimple.gop/

Due to passage of tax reform, companies across America announced bonuses and pay raises for our workforce, as well as increased U.S. investments! To name a few, AT&T will provide more than 200,000 employees with a $1,000 bonus. Fifth Third Bancorp plans to increase wages for their employees and provide a bonus. Boeing announced a $300 million investment to support charitable giving, workforce development and infrastructure. This is great news for our hardworking families.
From our family to yours, wishing you a very Merry Christmas and a joyous holiday season!

Our new tax code will continue to provide Michiganders with important tax benefits and deductions, including relief for high medical bills, mortgage interest, state and local taxes, the adoption tax credit, and higher education tax relief for our students. Learn more: https://fairandsimple.gop/
